stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes the position of the phospholipids within the phospholipid bilayer of the plasma membrane?
choicesHtml: The hydrophilic heads face the inner region of the membrane, and the hydrophobic tails point outward.
The hydrophilic tails face the inner region of the membrane, and the hydrophobic heads point outward.
The hydrophobic heads face the inner region of the membrane, and the hydrophilic tails point outward.
The hydrophobic tails face the inner region of the membrane, and the hydrophilic heads point outward.
